quote1: We, the Ahl al-Bayt of the Prophet, are the means of communication between Allah and His creation. We are the chosen, pure, and sacred ones of the Lord; we will be the proof and the guide; and we are the heirs of the divine prophets.
quote1Source: (Sharh Nahj al-Balagha by Ibn Abi al-Hadid: Vol. 16, p. 211.)
quote2: Whoever performs their acts of worship and deeds sincerely for Allah, Allah will decree for them the best of His benefits and blessings.
quote3: Always serve your mother and be devoted to her, for paradise lies beneath the feet of mothers, and the result will be heavenly blessings.
quote4: Smiling and joy in front of a believer will lead to entering paradise, while smiling in front of enemies and opponents will result in safety from punishment.
quote5: The Almighty Allah has made faith and belief for purification from polytheism and salvation from misguidance and misery; and prayer for humility and purity from all forms of arrogance; and zakat (and khums) for the purification of the soul and the expansion of sustenance; and fasting for steadfastness and sincerity in intention; and pilgrimage for strengthening the foundations of the Shari'ah and the establishment of the religion of Islam.
quote6: If you act upon what we, the Ahl al-Bayt, have commanded and refrain from what we have prohibited, you are one of our Shi'ah; otherwise, you are not.
quote7: My father, the Messenger of Allah (PBUH), said to me: Generosity is a tree in paradise, and its branches are in this world; whoever holds onto one of its branches will be brought into paradise.
quote8: My father, the Messenger of Allah (PBUH), said to me: Do not be stingy; for stinginess is a tree in the fire [of hell], and its branches are in this world; whoever holds onto one of its branches will be led into the fire.
quote9: Three things from this world are beloved to me: reciting the Quran, looking at the face of the Messenger of Allah, and giving charity and helping the needy in the way of Allah.
quote10: The best thing for preserving a woman's dignity is that she does not see a man and is not seen by men.
